availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Smith (Garrard County, Ky, druggist)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, druggist. Kentucky native. Druggist in Lancaster, Kentucky, in 1860. Commissioned in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from October 1862. Tried for maliciously shooting Joshua Burdett in Garrard County on November 26, 1862. Dismissed from military service in December 1862. Failed to appear for trial in February 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard, Lancaster, p. 639.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 260.
Find A Grave, “James H. Smith (1838-1868),” Memorial #107279226, (accessed June 4, 2017).
KYR-0001-004-0353.
